intro: Prenia tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled panga, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its quadrangular stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Prenia tetragona is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
